DataElement.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Period Active Ingredient Dose Total ISO21090.PQ.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The total amount of active ingredient in all doses of treatment in a given period of time.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Period Active Ingredient Dose Total
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._An interval of time.:The pharmaceutically active components of a preparation.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.:Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: An interval of time.:The pharmaceutically active components of a preparation.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.:Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

Concepts.definition: The pharmaceutically active components of a preparation.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Dimensioned quantity expressing the result of measuring.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
